page.title: 01The Edge of Breckland
page.content: The land in this block is situated on the southern edge of the Breckland, is slightly undulating and mainly sandy and light in character. It includes the main parts of the 2 typical rural villages of Culford and West Stow which have become virtually dormitory villages for Bury St Edmunds and Thetford since the reduction in labour requiremens for farming in the area. Farming is mainly arable with a tendency for the fields to be rather large with the removal of a lot of the old hedgerows. The slow running and non navigable River Lark traverses one corner of the area on its way to join the River Ouse. The area also includes part of the 5,500 acre Kings Forest planted to commemorate the Jubilee of the King George V which also provides an easy accessible recreation area for the residents of Bury St Edmunds.
